I learnt about Haiti's history and rich culture while also obtaining writing skills. Also, we were given the opportunity to teach a seminar about one aspect of the Haitian society, which allowed us to fully submerge into the world of research and analysis and further draw parallels between Haiti and contemporary issues.
It is a lot of just writing and talking, maybe some more engaging activities. Overall great course, though!

The readings were all very interesting and the topic was engaging, but the discussions were painful since it seemed that no one did the readings so there was no meaningful discussion about them. Having students lead the discussions was okay to a point, but it made it difficult to have meaningful discussions since many times the students were just reading from their notes instead of trying to facilitate discussion. Maybe having classes be split so that students lead the discussion for half the class and then the professor leads for the remainder would be a better balance.

Strengths: So much fun, very interesting topics, great and understanding teacher

Weaknesses: Way too early in the morning
